GT.content: perversity can always secretly corrupt the “donner raison à l’autre”: ratio, logos, is on your side [re: “Counterfeit Money”], what counts, can be counted, you took maximum pleasure

sur-vient, the event, Nietzsche’s Doppelgänger, ghosts, consists in nothing but coming about, being gone

ATIA.content: bottomless gaze of other [Levinas], the animal [?], seeing not just seen eyes of other; abyssal limit of the human, ends of man, bordercrossing where man announces himself, ultimate and first event of the end, unveiling, verdict; instant of extreme passion, je suis the apocalypse itself > when all this passes I can speak calmly of beasts of Apocalypse, visit them at the zoo

EL.content: for Scholem, secularized = pulling out language’s apocalyptic thorn; but secularization does not take place, a surface effect, language still sacred in its abyssal interior
EL.linkedContent: for Scholem, secularized = pulling out language’s apocalyptic thorn; but secularization does not take place, a surface effect, language still sacred in its abyssal interior

EL.content: Scholem’s equivocal use of word apocalypse, fascination w/ abyss : indecision that he can’t, doesn’t want, to master > apocalypse should be guarded (saved), and we should guard against it
EL.linkedContent: Scholem’s equivocal use of word apocalypse, fascination w/ abyss : indecision that he can’t, doesn’t want, to master > apocalypse should be guarded (saved), and we should guard against it

EL.content: secularize (desacralize): remove point, sting (Stachel), apocalyptic thorn of language > sting, this teleological aim (visée), institutes sacredness of language > this sacred language (Hebrew) would be nothing w/out magnetized pointer of apocalypse (cette pointe aimantée d’apocalypse)
EL.linkedContent: secularize (desacralize): remove point, sting (Stachel), apocalyptic thorn of language > sting, this teleological aim (visée), institutes sacredness of language > this sacred language (Hebrew) would be nothing w/out magnetized pointer of apocalypse (cette pointe aimantée d’apocalypse)

EL.content: apocalyptô: 1) decrypting what is hidden, revelation/unveiling 2) end time, last judgment 3) catastrophe, cataclysm
EL.linkedContent: apocalyptô: 1) decrypting what is hidden, revelation/unveiling 2) end time, last judgment 3) catastrophe, cataclysm

EL.content: Scholem: apocalypse, form of acute Messianism > writers of apocalypse (Daniel) distinct from prophets (Hosea, Amos, Isaiah): prophets don’t describe specific events of end; apocalypse speaks whole history (from origin to end), & coming of new aeon (Greek aiôn, Hebrew ‘olam) > aeons of apocalypse follow each other while opposing each other: present/future, darkness/light, Israel/nations, holiness/sin, pure/impure, life/death

EL.content: against cosmic/cosmopolitan background of apocalypses that ideas of last judgment, resurrection of dead, & paradise/hell have appeared
EL.linkedContent: against cosmic/cosmopolitan background of apocalypses that ideas of last judgment, resurrection of dead, & paradise/hell have appeared

EL.content: Scholem protests against Christianizing Messianism, interiorizing & spiritualizing, a flight seeking to escape verification of Messianic, apocalyptic claim
EL.linkedContent: Scholem protests against Christianizing Messianism, interiorizing & spiritualizing, a flight seeking to escape verification of Messianic, apocalyptic claim

EL.content: Scholem describes a move from national, exoteric [straightforward] Messianism to cryptographic, esoteric, elitist, apocalypticism accentuated by Jews losing their nation: the cryptic veil becomes “its very phenomenality, its state and its efficacy”

EL.content: will apocalyptic path upon which we’re engaged lose us, save us?

EL.content: Geschlecht and Schlag (stamp, imprint) > “we” that undergoes relation to itself out of (depuis) menacing interpellation of Geschlecht by apocalyptic speech (parole)

TN.content: following Nancy’s interpretation of The Death of the Virgin, [Life comme une Morte] a “tôt” announcing an apocalypse (an end not a future) > night of nonknowledge, every desire gathers momentum, Psyche ex-posed to other, surrendered but all too soon denied to the other’s eyes

BSi.content: [“you’re stupid”: Cartesian, apocalyptic verdict, final judgment]

ATAP.content: words gala and apokalupsis share numerous accords—still gaps, deviations > Greek apokaluptō, a witticism (bon mot) for, hospitable to Hebrew gala ——lever/relever all senses (meanings) pressing around Hebrew gala, in front of columns/colossi of Greece, in front of the galactic, the milky ways that fascinate me

ATAP.content: numerology, Plato’s amazement w/ geometric figures, illumination, Pythagorean mysticism, vision—all belong to apocalyptic world, crypto-politics, -poetics, [for Kant] perversion of philosophy > matter of veil & castration [that is, who will unveil? who speaks w/out mastery?]

ATAP.linkedContent: apocalypse as dream of raising (aufheben) veil of Isis

ATAP.content: West dominated by powerful program of ends: Hegel, Nietzsche, Marx (trying to forget differences btwn Hegel & Marx perhaps another eschatology of Marxism): end of Oedipus, of class struggle, of God, of history, of religions, of Christianity & morals (ça, the most serious naiveté), of subject, of man, of earth, of literature: in blood, fire, earthquake, napalm descending sky by helicopters, like prostitutes—the nuclear thunder & the great whoring

ATAP.content: this death sentence, cet arrêt de mort, can only judge us, those who don’t know this secret are already dead, so… let’s make a sect, sex, gender, race (Geschlecht) by ourselves [Babel scene] > we are the only ones in the world

EU.content: [re: politico-juridical system of university] Derrida beyond [?] political right/left, on the side of a tireless parasite [passe et repasse la limite] seeking conflict or perpetual peace in a university that has from its birth (dès sa naissance) en mal (been wanting) d’apocalypse et d’eschatologie
